intro: Laseguea acutifolia f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved laseguea, is a variant of the species Laseguea acutifolia, characterized by its smooth, glabrous foliage. This plant is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. It typically features slender stems and small, fern-like leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers are usually small and white or pale green, clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
